question: Who led the Israelites out of Egypt?
explanation: God called Moses to lead His people out of slavery in Egypt to the Promised Land.

verses.kjv: Come now therefore, and I will send thee unto Pharaoh, that thou mayest bring forth my people the children of Israel out of Egypt.

question: How many years did the Israelites wander in the wilderness?
explanation: Because of their disobedience, the Israelites wandered in the wilderness for 40 years.

verses.kjv: And your children shall wander in the wilderness forty years, and bear your whoredoms, until your carcases be wasted in the wilderness.

question: What did God provide for the Israelites to eat in the wilderness?
explanation: God provided manna each morning and quail each evening to feed the Israelites in the wilderness.

verses.kjv:
And it came to pass, that at even the quails came up, and covered the camp: and in the morning the dew lay round about the host.
And when the dew that lay was gone up, behold, upon the face of the wilderness
there lay a small round thing,
as small as the hoar frost on the ground.
And when the children of Israel saw
it, they said one to another, It
is manna: for they wist not what it
was.
 And Moses said unto them, This
is the bread which the LORD hath given you to eat.

question: Through which body of water did the Israelites cross to escape Egypt?
explanation: God parted the Red Sea so the Israelites could cross on dry ground while escaping Pharaoh's army.

verses.kjv:
And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the LORD caused the sea to go
back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea dry
land, and the waters were divided.

question: Who led the Israelites across the Jordan River into the Promised Land?
explanation: After Moses died, Joshua led the people across the Jordan River on dry ground into Canaan.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, This day will I begin to magnify thee in the sight of all Israel, that they may know that, as I was with Moses, so I will be with thee.

question: On what mountain did Moses receive the Ten Commandments?
explanation: God called Moses to the top of Mount Sinai to give him the Law written on stone tablets.

verses.kjv:
And the LORD came down upon mount Sinai, on the top of the mount: and the LORD called Moses
up to the top of the mount; and Moses went up.

question: Who went with Ruth to Bethlehem?
explanation: Naomi returned from Moab with Ruth the Moabite, her daughter-in-law.

verses.kjv: So Naomi returned, and Ruth the Moabitess, her daughter in law, with her, which returned out of the country of Moab: and they came to Bethlehem in the beginning of barley harvest.

question: What did the pillar of cloud and fire guide the Israelites through?
explanation: God went ahead of them in a pillar of cloud by day and fire by night to guide them through the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And the LORD went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud, to lead them the way; and by night in a pillar of fire, to give them light; to go by day and night:

question: Who returned to rebuild the walls of Jerusalem?
explanation: Nehemiah asked the king for permission to return to Jerusalem to rebuild the city walls.

verses.kjv: And I said unto the king, If it please the king, and if thy servant have found favour in thy sight, that thou wouldest send me unto Judah, unto the city of my fathers’ sepulchres, that I may build it.

question: Where did Joseph's brothers sell him?
explanation: They sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites for twenty shekels of silver, and he was taken to Egypt.

verses.kjv:
Then there passed by Midianites merchantmen; and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmeelites for twenty
pieces of silver: and they brought Joseph into Egypt.

question: What did the Israelites complain about in the wilderness?
explanation: The Israelites said to Moses and Aaron, 'If only we had died in Egypt where we had meat and bread!'

verses.kjv:
And the children of Israel said unto them, Would to God we had died by the hand of the LORD in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the flesh pots,
and when we did eat bread to the full; for ye have brought us forth into this wilderness, to kill this whole assembly with hunger.

question: Where did Jonah try to flee to instead of Nineveh?
explanation: Jonah ran away from the Lord and headed for Tarshish to flee from the Lord.

verses.kjv: But Jonah rose up to flee unto Tarshish from the presence of the LORD, and went down to Joppa; and he found a ship going to Tarshish: so he paid the fare thereof, and went down into it, to go with them unto Tarshish from the presence of the LORD.

question: How long was Jonah in the belly of the fish?
explanation: Jonah was in the belly of the huge fish three days and three nights.

verses.kjv: Now the LORD had prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.

question: Where did the Israelites cross into the Promised Land?
explanation: The priests carrying the ark stood firm on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan while Israel crossed over.

verses.kjv: And the priests that bare the ark of the covenant of the LORD stood firm on dry ground in the midst of Jordan, and all the Israelites passed over on dry ground, until all the people were passed clean over Jordan.

question: How many people were saved in the ark?
explanation: Only a few people, eight in all, were saved through water in Noah's ark.

verses.kjv: Which sometime were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved by water.

question: Who interpreted dreams for Pharaoh in Egypt?
explanation: Pharaoh said to Joseph, 'I had a dream, and no one can interpret it. But I have heard you can interpret dreams.'

verses.kjv:
And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I have dreamed a dream, and
there is
 none that can interpret it: and I have heard say of thee,
that
 thou canst understand a dream to interpret it.

question: Who led the Israelites after Moses died?
explanation: After the death of Moses the servant of the Lord, the Lord said to Joshua son of Nun, Moses' aide.

verses.kjv: Now after the death of Moses the servant of the LORD it came to pass, that the LORD spake unto Joshua the son of Nun, Moses’ minister, saying,

question: How long was Daniel in the lions' den?
explanation: At the first light of dawn, the king got up and hurried to the lions' den.

verses.kjv: Then the king arose very early in the morning, and went in haste unto the den of lions.

question: How many plagues did God send on Egypt?
explanation: God sent ten plagues upon Egypt to convince Pharaoh to let the Israelites go.

verses.kjv:
And the LORD said unto Moses, Pharaoh’s heart
is hardened, he refuseth to let the people go.

question: Where did Moses receive the Ten Commandments?
explanation: The Lord descended to the top of Mount Sinai and called Moses to come up to receive the commandments.

verses.kjv:
And the LORD came down upon mount Sinai, on the top of the mount: and the LORD called Moses
up to the top of the mount; and Moses went up.

question: What river did the Israelites cross to enter the Promised Land?
explanation: The priests who carried the ark stood firm on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan while all Israel passed by.

verses.kjv: And the priests that bare the ark of the covenant of the LORD stood firm on dry ground in the midst of Jordan, and all the Israelites passed over on dry ground, until all the people were passed clean over Jordan.

question: Where did Jonah end up after being thrown overboard?
explanation: The Lord provided a huge fish to swallow Jonah, and Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days.

verses.kjv: Now the LORD had prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.

question: What did the Israelites build while Moses was on Mount Sinai?
explanation: Aaron took their gold and made it into an idol cast in the shape of a calf.

verses.kjv:
And he received
them at their hand, and fashioned it with a graving tool, after he had made it a molten calf: and they said, These
be thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.

question: To which island was John exiled when he wrote Revelation?
explanation: I, John, your brother, was on the island of Patmos because of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus.

verses.kjv: I John, who also am your brother, and companion in tribulation, and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ, was in the isle that is called Patmos, for the word of God, and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.

question: What was the first plague on Egypt?
explanation: Moses and Aaron did just as the Lord had commanded. He raised his staff and struck the water of the Nile, and all the water was changed into blood.

verses.kjv:
And Moses and Aaron did so, as the LORD commanded; and he lifted up the rod, and smote the waters that
were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his servants; and all the waters that
were
 in the river were turned to blood.

question: What was the last plague on Egypt?
explanation: Every firstborn son in Egypt will die, from the firstborn son of Pharaoh to the firstborn of the female slave.

verses.kjv:
And all the firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh that sitteth upon his throne, even unto the firstborn of the maidservant that
is behind the mill; and all the firstborn of beasts.

question: What body of water did Moses part?
explanation: Then Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and all that night the Lord drove the sea back with a strong east wind and turned it into dry land.

verses.kjv:
And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the LORD caused the sea to go
back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea dry
land, and the waters were divided.

question: Where did God give Moses the Ten Commandments?
explanation: The Lord descended to the top of Mount Sinai and called Moses to the top of the mountain.

verses.kjv:
And the LORD came down upon mount Sinai, on the top of the mount: and the LORD called Moses
up to the top of the mount; and Moses went up.

question: Who bought Joseph in Egypt?
explanation: Now Joseph had been taken down to Egypt. Potiphar, an Egyptian who was one of Pharaoh's officials, bought him from the Ishmaelites.

verses.kjv: And Joseph was brought down to Egypt; and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him of the hands of the Ishmeelites, which had brought him down thither.

question: Why was Joseph put in prison?
explanation: When his master heard the story his wife told him, he burned with anger. Joseph's master took him and put him in prison.

verses.kjv:
And it came to pass, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spake unto him, saying, After this manner did thy servant to me; that his wrath was kindled.
And Joseph’s master took him, and put him into the prison, a place where the king’s prisoners
were bound: and he was there in the prison.

question: How many years of famine did Joseph predict?
explanation: But seven years of famine will follow them. Then all the abundance in Egypt will be forgotten, and the famine will ravage the land.

verses.kjv: And there shall arise after them seven years of famine; and all the plenty shall be forgotten in the land of Egypt; and the famine shall consume the land;

question: Who recognized Joseph's robe?
explanation: He recognized it and said, 'It is my son's robe! Some ferocious animal has devoured him. Joseph has surely been torn to pieces.'

verses.kjv:
And he knew it, and said,
It is my son’s coat; an evil beast hath devoured him; Joseph is without doubt rent in pieces.

question: What position did Joseph hold in Egypt?
explanation: You shall be in charge of my palace, and all my people are to submit to your orders. Only with respect to the throne will I be greater than you.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt be over my house, and according unto thy word shall all my people be ruled: only in the throne will I be greater than thou.

question: What did Joseph's brothers bow down before him fulfilling?
explanation: Now Joseph was the governor of the land; he was the one who sold grain to all its people. So when Joseph's brothers arrived, they bowed down to him with their faces to the ground.

verses.kjv:
And Joseph
was the governor over the land,
and he
it was that sold to all the people of the land: and Joseph’s brethren came, and bowed down themselves before him
with their faces to the earth.

question: Where did Moses lead the Israelites from?
explanation: At the end of the 430 years, to the very day, all the Lord's divisions left Egypt.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of the four hundred and thirty years, even the selfsame day it came to pass, that all the hosts of the LORD went out from the land of Egypt.

question: Which sea did the Israelites cross when leaving Egypt?
explanation: Then Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and the Lord drove the sea back and the Israelites went through the sea on dry ground.

verses.kjv:
And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the LORD caused the sea to go
back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea dry
land, and the waters were divided.
And the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea upon the dry
ground: and the waters
were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.

question: What did God use to lead the Israelites by day and by night in the wilderness (Exodus 13:21)?
choices: A pillar of cloud by day and a pillar of fire by night
explanation: Exodus 13:21 says the LORD went before Israel in a pillar of cloud by day and a pillar of fire by night to lead them.

verses.kjv: And the LORD went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud, to lead them the way; and by night in a pillar of fire, to give them light; to go by day and night:

question: What body of water did the Israelites cross when they went out of Egypt (Exodus 14:22)?
explanation: Exodus 14:22 says the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea upon dry ground, with waters as a wall on both sides.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea upon the dry ground: and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.

question: Where did Jacob go to flee from his brother Esau (Genesis 28:5)?
explanation: Genesis 28:5 says Isaac sent Jacob away and he went to Padanaram, to Laban.

verses.kjv: And Isaac sent away Jacob: and he went to Padanaram unto Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob's and Esau's mother.

question: Where did Joseph's brothers sell him (Genesis 37:28)?
explanation: Genesis 37:28 says the Midianites sold Joseph into Egypt unto Potiphar.

verses.kjv: Then there passed by Midianites merchantmen; and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmeelites for twenty pieces of silver: and they brought Joseph into Egypt.

question: When Naomi and Ruth arrived in Bethlehem, what time of harvest was it (Ruth 1:22)?
explanation: Ruth 1:22 says Naomi and Ruth came to Bethlehem in the beginning of barley harvest.

verses.kjv: So Naomi returned, and Ruth the Moabitess, her daughter in law, with her, which returned out of the country of Moab: and they came to Bethlehem in the beginning of barley harvest.

question: Which river did the priests stand in when Israel crossed over on dry ground (Joshua 3:17)?
explanation: Joshua 3:17 says the priests with the ark stood firm on dry ground in the midst of Jordan while all Israel passed over.

verses.kjv: And the priests that bare the ark of the covenant of the LORD stood firm on dry ground in the midst of Jordan, and all the Israelites passed over on dry ground, until all the people were passed clean over Jordan.

question: To what city did Jonah flee when he rose up to flee from the presence of the LORD (Jonah 1:3)?
explanation: Jonah 1:3 says Jonah rose up to flee unto Tarshish from the presence of the LORD.

verses.kjv: But Jonah rose up to flee unto Tarshish from the presence of the LORD, and went down to Joppa; and he found a ship going to Tarshish: so he paid the fare thereof, and went down into it, to go with them unto Tarshish from the presence of the LORD.

question: Where did Paul and Barnabas sail after they had been recommended to the grace of God (Acts 13:4)?
explanation: Acts 13:4 says they departed unto Seleucia, and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.

verses.kjv: So they, being sent forth by the Holy Ghost, departed unto Seleucia; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.

question: To what city was Philip directed by the angel of the Lord to go on the road that goes down from Jerusalem (Acts 8:26)?
explanation: Acts 8:26 tells Philip to go toward the south unto the way that goes down from Jerusalem unto Gaza.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, Arise, and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza, which is desert.

question: When Paul had purposed in the spirit to go to Jerusalem, what destination did he say he must see after passing through Macedonia and Achaia (Acts 19:21)?
explanation: Acts 19:21 records Paul's plan and his statement: "I must also see Rome."

verses.kjv: After these things were ended, Paul purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I must also see Rome.

question: Where was Paul kept for two years by Felix (Acts 24:27)?
explanation: Acts 24:27 says Felix left Paul bound (in bonds) when he was succeeded by Porcius Festus.

verses.kjv: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix' room: and Felix, willing to shew the Jews a pleasure, left Paul bound.

question: To what island was John exiled for the word of God and for the testimony of Jesus Christ (Revelation 1:9)?
explanation: Revelation 1:9 says John was in the isle called Patmos for the word of God and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: I John, who also am your brother, and companion in tribulation, and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ, was in the isle that is called Patmos, for the word of God, and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.

question: After the shipwreck, what was the name of the island where the people showed Paul and the others no little kindness (Acts 28:1-2)?
explanation: Acts 28:1-2 says the island was called Melita and the barbarous people showed them no little kindness.

verses.kjv: And when they were escaped, then they knew that the island was called Melita. And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness: for they kindled a fire, and received us every one, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.
